location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of the Beni Bu Ali Fort was taken directly overhead on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.Due north and northeast of the fort, which is just below centre, are a large number of walled dwellings. Further enclosures and dwellings are visible to the west and south of the fort. This image depicts almost the same area as depicted in IOR/R/15/1/444, f. 128f.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture. North is indicated alongside the inscriptions in the upper right corner.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.A.128.V BENI-BU-ALI-FORT 4.2.32-1015 F6" 4000'Verso, ink stamp: 'ROYAL AIR FORCE OFFICIAL CROWN COPYRIGHT RESERVED U203 Date 18/2/32'; 'FOR OFFICIAL USE ONLY'Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 10.15 am.
